test_plan.display_value:
1. Go to Time Sheet Portal and add an unassigned task on portal or select any project.
2. Verify that you have the option to select story as child task.
3. Upon selection verify that story and project has link as task number and short description above.
4. Verify when you select a project in which you don't have role time card is not created with appropriate message.
5. Verify if a story has no project time card is not created with appropriate message.
6. Verify if a story has approved time card( at least one) story field is not changed on time card.

u_update_set.display_value: FA-STRY0010199-Time tracking for Agile 2.0, AK;STRY0010199;Time tracking for Agile 2.0, AK;STRY0011297;Prevent time card creation, AK;STRY0011314;New BR on story table

description.display_value: This change request proposes enhancements to the time tracking functionality for Stories. A new field will be added to the time card to display the project linked with the associated Story. When employees track time against a Story on the portal, the related Project should be visible. Additionally, users should not be allowed to track time on Stories that are linked to closed projects. Time card creation will be restricted under two conditions: if the Story is not associated with any Project, or if the user has no assigned role in the related Project—both scenarios will trigger appropriate error messages. Furthermore, if a Story has any approved time cards under a specific project (Project A), it must not be allowed to move to another project (Project B), in compliance with an existing business rule that prevents changes to the task on approved time card records. These changes are intended to enforce governance, ensure accurate time reporting, and prevent unauthorized or inconsistent data updates.
description.value: This change request proposes enhancements to the time tracking functionality for Stories. A new field will be added to the time card to display the project linked with the associated Story. When employees track time against a Story on the portal, the related Project should be visible. Additionally, users should not be allowed to track time on Stories that are linked to closed projects. Time card creation will be restricted under two conditions: if the Story is not associated with any Project, or if the user has no assigned role in the related Project—both scenarios will trigger appropriate error messages. Furthermore, if a Story has any approved time cards under a specific project (Project A), it must not be allowed to move to another project (Project B), in compliance with an existing business rule that prevents changes to the task on approved time card records. These changes are intended to enforce governance, ensure accurate time reporting, and prevent unauthorized or inconsistent data updates.
